Version: 3.1.2
Build id: M20051216-0800
Which version of WTP are you using, and which runtime did you select? Have you tried on RC5?
No response, so I'm assuming that this is either fixed in 1.0 or is caused by a bad JRE install. Dropped a fix to avoid the NPE in the case of a bad JRE to HEAD and will tag shortly to 1.0.1.

Could it be that the fix just modified the bug but did not fix it?
Anyways, I found that it does work with Tomcat 5.0.30 but when you use Tomcat 5.5.15 the following problem occurs:

(In reply to comment #3)
> Released for next 1.0.1 build.
>

Found the problem (at least in this case) - JDT is returning a version string for the JRE you are using that isn't recognized by the runtime bridge.

If you have a development environment setup, can you set a breakpoint on line 154 and see what the value of jvmver is? Otherwise, could you do a "java -version" from the commandline and paste the results here?
Hi Volker, please see comments above.

I've noticed the IllegalStateException will happen if I define a runtime and assign to a Sun Mustang JRE (jvmver = 1.6). I don't know if this is actually "legal", but nothing stops me from doing it. Once this runtime exists, all future attempts to create a new dynamic web project (+ possibly other things?) will fail with the IllegalStateException. I can get rid of the exceptions again by editing the server to use an earler JRE. 

Even if using 1.6 is a no-no, this problem could easily trip up a novice, and, of course, it is not easy to diagnose.
Should have mentioned I was experimenting using Eclipse 3.1.1 and a cut of WTP 1.0.1, not 3.2M4 and WTP 1.5.  3.2M4 does have JavaCore.VERSION_1_6 that JavaFacetUtils.setCompilerLevel() could use.

JDT doesn't support Java 1.6 in 3.1/1.0, so that's why it's failing there. I'd still like to see Volker's jvmver (he was using 1.5 so it must have some odd format in the version string), but I'll put in a few catch-alls to make sure that it'll default to something usable in the meantime. (e.g. I'll default 1.6 to the Java 5.0 settings for 1.0.1) I'm hoping not to have to split streams for 1.5 for a couple weeks yet, so I'm going to put these changes in both streams until facets have added support for 1.6.

Gordon or Hirsch - Can one of you open a bug against facets (wst.common) to start supporting 1.6 in the WTP 1.5 release?

(In reply to comment #10)

Tim,

I tried a variety of versions:
- 3.1.1 or 3.2M4
- WTP 1.0 or WTP1.5M4
- JRE/JDK 1.5.0_06 or JRE/JDK 1.6.0

Below are the java versions reported:

java full version "1.5.0_06-b05"
java full version "1.6.0-rc-b67"

But using Tomcat 5.0.x instead of 5.5 fixes the thing. :-/

If I can do anything to help let me know.

Volker

124317 has been opened.
Fix released for next 1.0.1 M-build and will be released for WTP 1.5 build shortly.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old its assumed fixed and no longer useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.
